articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dawoud Abu Alkas
articles.description: An Israeli military strike killed 12 people in a house in Gaza City early on Saturday, bringing the death toll from strikes across Gaza to 62 over the last day, Palestinian medics said, as mediators launched a new ceasefire push in Qatar.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in Gaza Strip as new ceasefire talks begin

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: Thousands braved heavy snow in Seoul on Sunday to rally for and against arresting impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol, as South Korea's political crisis appeared headed toward another high-stakes confrontation.
articles.title: South Korea protesters rally for, against Yoon arrest as deadline looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni flew to Florida to meet with President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday, as the key European leader sought to buttress ties with Trump before his inauguration on Jan. 20.
articles.title: Italian Prime Minister Meloni meets with Trump at his Florida resort

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China said on Sunday it would launch 15 measures to bolster the development of its western provinces with the construction of logistical infrastructure such as ports and aviation hubs.
articles.title: China seeks to bolster ports and aviation hubs in western regions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Greek Prime Minister Costas Simitis, who ushered the country into the European Union's single currency in 2001, died on Sunday aged 88 at his summer house in the Peloponnese, Greek media reported.
articles.title: Former Greek Prime Minister Simitis dies aged 88

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian airports in the cities of Kazan, Nizhnekamsk, Izhevsk and Perm, which temporarily halted flights on Sunday morning to ensure the safety of civilian aircraft, have resumed normal operations, the aviation watchdog Rosaviatsia said.
articles.title: Four Russian airports reopen after suspending flights, aviation watchdog says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syrian Foreign Minister Asaad Hassan al-Shibani, appointed by the country's new rulers, arrived in Doha on Sunday to meet Qatar's Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani, a Qatari official told Reuters.
articles.title: Syrian foreign minister in Doha to meet Qatar's prime minister

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian and Western assessments say that some 11,000 North Korean troops are deployed in the Kursk region.
articles.title: Zelenskiy reports heavy Russian, North Korean troop losses in Russia's Kursk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Palestinian man was shot dead by Israeli forces during a raid in the occupied West Bank on Sunday, the Palestinian Fatah party said in a statement.
articles.title: Palestinian killed by Israeli forces in the West Bank, Palestinian sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Talks between the two biggest centrist parties in Austria on forming a coalition government without the far-right Freedom Party (FPO) have collapsed, Chancellor Karl Nehammer said on Saturday, adding that he would step down in the coming days.
articles.title: Austrian coalition talks collapse, chancellor to step down
